siteMetadata.title: Cooking In Pajamas
siteMetadata.description: Stories and Musings from Wayfaring Adventurers and Aspiring Home Cooks.

node.title: DAMN SON, Those are Some Seriously Loaded Fries
node.plaintext:
For the few weeks, I've been bored at home while my parents are away at work.
I've been taking some time off between graduation and when I start work next
month. So when one of my friends was also bored at home during her spring break,
she decided to come over and join me in being a bum for a day. And what better
food to have while lazing around then some Mexican loaded fries.



Feel free to use sour cream instead of ranch or even add guacamole and other
toppings you usually put on nachos! We didn't really want to leave the house and
go grocery shopping, so we went with whatever was in the fridge. I usually make
my own mexican seasoning, but feel free to replace the spices with a store
bought seasoning if you want.



Mexican Loaded Fries
This is a very rough recipe. Feel free to throw in whatever you feel would taste
best!

Ingredients:
½ bag of fries (I used crinkle cut)
 ranch (or sour cream)
 as much shredded cheese as you wantRefried Beans
1 can black beans
 1½ teaspoons cumin powder
 1 teaspoon paprika
 salt to taste
 cayenne pepper to taste
 chili lime hot sauce to taste (optional)Pico De Gallo Salsa
3 roma tomatoes diced
 ½ large onion diced
 juice of ½ a lime
 salt to taste
 few sprigs of cilantro Directions:
Refried Beans:  Pour the black beans onto a skillet on the stove. Add all of the
spices and keep stirring until the beans are soft and are super flavorful.

Salsa:Mix all the ingredients in a bowl and let it sit so that the salt and lime
can bring out the flavor in the tomatoes.

Bake the fries according to the directions on the packet. When the fries are
done, don't turn off the oven. Top with the bean mixture and sprinkle all the
cheese that your heart desires. Bake the topped fries in the oven until the
cheese has melted. Take out the fries and top with salsa and ranch. Dig in!
